quote: There is another world, and it is in this one.
author: Paul Éluard

quote: I am my world.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: He is my world and my world is him and without him there is no world.
author: Lauren Oliver,  Delirium

quote: I change the world, the world changes me.
author: Libba Bray

quote: To the world you may be one person but to one person you may be the world.
author: Bill Wilson

quote: Here, in this quiet place we own, worlds are born.
author: Cassandra Wilson Run the Voodoo Down

quote: I do like the world quite a lot.
author: Shannon Hale,  Book of a Thousand Days

quote: Who in the world am I? Ah, that's the great puzzle.
author: Lewis Carroll,  Alice in Wonderland

quote: Your world is a living expression of how you are using and have used your mind.
author: Earl Nightingale

quote: Remake the world, a little at a time, each in your own corner of the world.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: I want my world to start and end with you.
author: E.L. James,  Fifty Shades of Grey

quote: The world is a dangerous place, but there is no better world. Remember every one of us is responsible to make the world a joyful place.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: You are the creator of your world.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: If you want the best the world has to offer, offer the world your best.
author: Neale Donald Walsch

quote: See the world as it is, not as you wish it would be
author: E. Lockhart,  We Were Liars

quote: Your true world is your state of consciousness and awareness where your minds dwells and dances.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: For a flicker of a moment I imagined a world completely different from the one I'd always known, a world in which I was treated with fairness, even kindness-- a world in which fathers didn't sell their daughters.
author: Arthur Golden

quote: This world is but a canvas to our imagination.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: In my imagination, this world is an amazingly beautiful, peaceful, loving and kind.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Some people try to change the world one life at a time. Others try to change the world one death at a time. And I try to change the world one bucket full of dirt at a time.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: Love of the world is the soul of the world.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: We live in the world when we love it.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: O world, world when I was younger I thought there was some order governing you and your deeds. But now you seem to be a labyrinth of errors, a frightful desert, a den of wild beasts, a game in which men move in circles…a stony field, a meadow full of serpents, a flowering but barren orchard, a spring of cares, a river of tears, a sea of suffering, a vain hope.
author: Fernando de Rojas,  La Celestina

quote: I wokeup in morning and saw, world has move on
author: Sukant Ratnakar,  Open the Windows

quote: Everybody has a secret world inside of them. I mean everybody. All of the people in the whole world, I mean everybody — no matter how dull and boring they are on the outside. Inside them they've all got unimaginable, magnificent, wonderful, stupid, amazing worlds... Not just one world. Hundreds of them. Thousands, maybe.
author: Neil Gaiman,  The Sandman, Vol. 5: A Game of You

quote: Each man lives in many worlds within different life.Mind can only see world in which it lived and located.
author: Toba Beta,  My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut

quote: Each friend represents a world in us, a world possibly not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
author: Anaïs Nin,  The Diary of Anaïs Nin, Vol. 1: 1931-1934

quote: We choose our next world through what we learn in this one. Learn nothing, and the next world is the same as this one, all the same limitations and lead weights to overcome.
author: Richard Bach,  Jonathan Livingston Seagull

quote: If it’s going to be a world with no time for sentiment, it’s not a world that I want to live in.
author: Christopher Isherwood,  A Single Man

quote: The world belongs to those who read.
author: Rick Holland

quote: Through art, you create your own world.
author: Daphne Guinness

quote: I want to make this world perfect.
author: Malala Yousafzai

quote: The world is indeed comic, but the joke is on mankind.
author: H.P. Lovecraft

quote: The world is your exercise book, the pages on which you do your sums. It is not reality, though you may express reality there if you wish. You are also free to write lies, or nonsense, or to tear the pages.
author: Richard Bach,  Illusions: The Adventures of a Reluctant Messiah

quote: Love the world and yourself in it, move through it as though it offers no resistance, as though the world is your natural element.
author: Audrey Niffenegger,  The Time Traveler's Wife

quote: To those who will see, the world waits.
author: Libba Bray

quote: The most beautiful thing in the world is, of course, the world itself.
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: Only by showing the world the cataclysmic cost of a world divided can it appreciate the wonders of life and endless possibilities of a world united.
author: William Bailey,  Great Ship of Knowledge: Learning Earth's Deathly History

quote: The world is full of little dictators trying to run your life.
author: Alan King

quote: All the lives I could live, all the people I will never know, never will be, they are everywhere. That is all that the world is.
author: Aleksandar Hemon,  The Lazarus Project

quote: Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I live my life in widening circles that reach out across the world.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Rilke's Book of Hours: Love Poems to God

quote: The world is charged with the grandeur of God.
author: Gerard Manley Hopkins

quote: The world is bad but not without hope. It is only hopeless when you look at it from an ideal viewpoint.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: Everything changes in my life, and the world stays the same.
author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Ashes

quote: I wanted the whole world or nothing.
author: Charles Bukowski,  Post Office

quote: Don’t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first.
author: Mark Twain

quote: And a beautiful world we live in, when it is possible, and when many other such things are possible, and not only possible, but done-- done, see you!-- under that sky there, every day.
author: Charles Dickens,  A Tale of Two Cities

quote: Whoever saves one life, saves the world entire.
author: Thomas Keneally,  Schindler's List
